intro: Goughia, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a unique plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant has a distinctive root system that helps it anchor in rocky or coastal soils. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length, making it a striking feature in its natural habitat. Goughia is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in moist, temperate climates.
